abstract: It sounds like the deal by Time Warner to let paying Comcast subscribers watch its shows on the Internet protects old business models. It destroys them.
snippet: It sounds like the deal by Time Warner to let paying Comcast subscribers watch its shows on the Internet protects old business models. It destroys them.
lead_paragraph: For people who hope the openness and flexibility of the Internet will come to mainstream television, the deal announced Wednesday between Comcast and Time Warner is great news. They just don’t see yet how it blows apart the tight bond between cable content and cable delivery.

headline.main: Why the Comcast-Time Warner Deal Blasts Open TV

abstract: For people who hope the openness and flexibility of the Internet will come to mainstream television, the deal announced today between Comcast and Time Warner is great news. They just don’t see yet how it blows apart the tight bond between cable content and cable delivery.
